item.title: 15 – Risk
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Risk I prefer chunky peanut butter. I prefer to sit farthest from the door. I prefer indirect light, with a little shadow. I prefer cats curled up on my chest, not my stomach, which is irritable. I prefer left-handedness. I … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Risk

I prefer chunky peanut butter.
I prefer to sit farthest from the door.
I prefer indirect light, with a little shadow.
I prefer cats curled up on my chest,
not my stomach, which is irritable.
I prefer left-handedness.
I prefer dramas.
I prefer crew-neck t-shirts and sweaters.
I prefer the windows open.
I prefer to see faces in inanimate objects.
I prefer a little bit of risk, or at least
that is the box I check on forms: a little bit of risk.
I prefer to be on top.
I prefer my coffee black.
I prefer the facts, just the facts.
I prefer you not do that, please.
I prefer to sleep instead of fight.
I prefer the absurdity of writing poems
to the absurdity of not writing poems.
I prefer dark beer.
I prefer bees over wasps.
I prefer wasps over spiders.
I prefer rivers to oceans.
I prefer the feel of grass.
I prefer the bowls and cups on the top rack.
I prefer to keep my head down
while keeping an eye to the horizon.
I prefer to surprise, not be surprised.

 

(concept and “the absurdity of writing/not writing poems” lifted from the much better “Possibilities” by Wislawa Szymborska)

item.title: 14 – falafel
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: falafel this is beauty ready smile flick of a wrist hot oil spittling chickpea mash yellow rusting ocher care creasing tinfoil a hundred passers-by never notice Adar’s feline grace unleashed in this cramped van I buy much more than lunch … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
falafel

this is beauty
ready smile
flick of a wrist
hot oil spittling
chickpea mash yellow
rusting ocher
care creasing tinfoil
a hundred passers-by never notice
Adar’s feline grace unleashed
in this cramped van
I buy much more than lunch
for five dollars

item.title: 13 – Girl w/a Pearl Earring
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Girl w/a Pearl Earring I tore Vermeer’s girl from a magazine just her face one thin strip uncertain certain full of longing dash of head cap blue splash of yellow the aged grendel prowling my interior swamp died a little … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Girl w/a Pearl Earring

I tore Vermeer’s girl
from a magazine
just her face one thin strip
uncertain certain full of longing
dash of head cap blue splash of yellow
the aged grendel prowling
my interior swamp died
a little just a little want a little
true desire the heaving heart
beneath it all

item.title: 12 – an excellent assemblage
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: //experiment: erasure poem. new yorker. devonté hynes. “cupid deluxe”. listen.// an excellent assemblage Smooth operator: Devonté Hynes. Best ever or the worst: success or possessions? Unanimous: underestimating strangers tweet. Washington Square Park, visible breakout. Everything is embarrassing! Off-kilter, beyond the … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
//experiment: erasure poem. new yorker. devonté hynes. “cupid deluxe”. listen.//

an excellent assemblage

Smooth operator:
Devonté Hynes.

Best ever or the worst:
success or possessions?

Unanimous: underestimating
strangers tweet.

Washington Square Park,
visible breakout.

Everything is embarrassing!
Off-kilter, beyond the indie.

His girlfriend? Lou Reed Apollo.
The East Village burned down.

He lost a few days.
Exhaustion.

Regroup and look back—
Guyanese, Sierra Leone, Essex East.

Rackety outfit,
an uneasy alliance:

The Rapture,
Work in Blood.

Imagine having
Test Icicles!

America, Omaha,
Saddle Creek: room to deploy.

Slightly off balance.
Too small a frame.

Something in him was unlocked;
obvious attractions:

overalls and a leather cap,
major landmarks.

He unplugged
in late November.

End of the spectrum:
dance music;

rap rearranged
the regular time signature,

propulsive feel.
Daytime radio staples:

Tape and Razors
(a blend of anxiety and desire).

The real version?
Homage: frantic mixtapes.

Uncanny, steeped,
out of print.

Some references are overt
(Thwacking Nipple,

a soft cloud,
voices).

Many non-natives
you never knew

sneak in low,
sweet

sketch out
clean rhythm.

item.title: 11 – Poem(s)
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Poem(s) Grocery list. Movie marquee. Recipes. Half-heard conversation. Each particular step required to field-dress a deer, recited under the breath like a prayer, for the first you took in a yellow wood on the Owyhee. A name for every bone … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Poem(s)

Grocery list. Movie marquee.
Recipes. Half-heard conversation.
Each particular step required
to field-dress a deer, recited
under the breath like a prayer,
for the first you took in a yellow wood
on the Owyhee. A name for every bone
and the shape it takes and gives
to flesh. Shades and flights
of color. Music and the notes
it comes from. Or simply the sound
of your voice, aloud
or in your head, right now
bringing this into the world.

item.title: 10 – Shade
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Shade Old photos, like lovers’ spats, are never about what they’re about. We point and shoot from the hip, unguarded aching to convey the unsaid. Words, wounds, the particular angles of a face in the sun, shaded by a casual … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Shade

Old photos, like lovers’
spats, are never about
what they’re about.

We point and shoot
from the hip, unguarded
aching to convey

the unsaid. Words,
wounds, the particular
angles of a face in the sun,

shaded by a casual hand
raised in greeting
or defense.

item.title: 9 – Ghazal
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: //My first stab at writing a ghazal (ghazl-ing?). Apologies to the Persians. So it goes.// Ghazal We come to love and end in fight. So it goes. The bands of love are loosed tonight. So it goes. Dog is off … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
//My first stab at writing a ghazal (ghazl-ing?). Apologies to the Persians. So it goes.//

Ghazal

We come to love and end in fight. So it goes.
The bands of love are loosed tonight. So it goes.

Dog is off his chain. The hen has flown her coop.
Rat has slipped his cage, squeaking fright. So it goes.

In the hospital bed the blind boy is not
mourning his newfound loss of sight. So it goes.

Autumn drags its heavy chains; bitter winter
fells just-ripe apples lost to blight. So it goes.

I had once a white-hot fire in a bowl
this cup of flame burned out, lost light. So it goes.

This ghazal is a new attempt at old forms;
ancient Persian poetry, marred. So it goes.

item.title: 8 – Fremont
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: //Fremont bridge on a foggy morning.// Fremont entering, the perfect curve commands. Westbound headlights hang in fog passing silently above their eastern brethren sweeping out over the city. Flags snap-to atop the arch saluting beauty, forged monument of our bent … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
//Fremont bridge on a foggy morning.//

Fremont

entering, the perfect curve
commands. Westbound
headlights hang in fog
passing silently above
their eastern brethren
sweeping out over the city.
Flags snap-to atop the arch
saluting beauty, forged
monument of our bent
-willed industry.

item.title: 7 – Fed
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Fed The choice is this: an hour of poems or slow-cooker chili. Which will feed you more? Which work of my hands most clearly says I love you?
item.content:encoded:
Fed

The choice is this:
an hour of poems
or slow-cooker chili.

Which will feed you more?
Which work of my hands
most clearly says I love you?

item.title: 6 – Monday
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Monday My heart is a bent bow. Its arrows are Yours. I am tense w/fear & trembling for I know not what mark they will make.
item.content:encoded:
Monday

My heart is a bent bow.

Its arrows are Yours.

I am tense

w/fear & trembling

for I know not what

mark they will make.
